My personal compliments. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

This is the first time I have clear evidence of some utility behaving "bad". ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

You managed to use (whatever) utility to write the MBR to that stick.  

Too bad that BEFORE the MBR the stick was (probably in factory) pre-formatted as super-floppy, and the "whatever" utility, INSTEAD of blanking the first sector AND writing a new MBR, simply wrote the MBR bytes leaving whatever there was before in all places where a "normal" MBR is 00.  
THESE:  
> Invalid system disk  
> Disk I/O error  
> Replace the

[http://www.msfn.org/...e....html\&st=25](http://www.msfn.org/board/error-0xc000000e-problem-t121391.html&st=25 "External link")  

are the rests of a "previous" bootsector.  

If I were you I would fix that MBR, writing 00's where they should be, re-writing the 2C4463 (offsets needed for error messages) keeping CODE (green), Disk Signature (lite blue), DATA (pink) and of course magic number 55AA (yellow), see here:  
[http://thestarman.pc...br/Win2kmbr.htm](http://thestarman.pcministry.com/asm/mbr/Win2kmbr.htm "External link")  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

jaclaz

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> Lol , don't understand if compliments are because I said something good or something wrong , lmao !!!
Because you brought forward actual evidence supporting something I 've been around years saying:  
[http://www.boot-land...opic=4015\&st=21](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=4015&st=21 "External link")  
![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Always zero out first sectors, this way you are guaranteed to "start clean".  

> But jaclaz, the more important thing, i don't want to fix this masterbbot, since this usb stick working so great that I'm afraid to loose it ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)   
>
> Tell me a thing: in the mbr is stored also something that is recalled later in hive system????? I mean, does system have a check with mbr or vice-versa?

Why would you lose it? ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

1)Save the MBR as is.  
2)Make a copy of it.  
3)Modify the copy.  
4)Write the modified copy to the stick.  
5)If anything does not work, simply restore the original copy, and loop again to 2) above.  

Get this:  
Italian  
[http://dimio.altervista.org/ita/](http://dimio.altervista.org/ita/ "External link")  

English:  
[http://dimio.altervista.org/eng/](http://dimio.altervista.org/eng/ "External link")  

instead of Winhex to save/restore MBR's (more user friendly).  

The data used in Registry is the Disk Signature and (part of) the DATA.  

By the way, if you like that stick that much, you should have made an image of it kept in a fire-resistant safebox....![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
A stick is NOT something actually reliable, a spark of statics, excessive heat, excessive humidity, whatever and you can kiss it goodbye.  

jaclaz

It seems like in some cases, read here: [http://www.911cd.net...o...1242\&st=142](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=21242&st=142 "External link") it is possible to boot with different signatures or with two different checksums, but there are not definite reports.

About PM, the XP3SD (that can be found here): [http://www.dedrispro...sd-utility.html](http://www.dedrisproject.com/blog/tutorial-xp3esd-utility.html "External link") as it's home page: [http://www.3eportal....c...16\&Itemid=1](http://www.3eportal.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=16&Itemid=1 "External link") has a suspended account, It appears to be an interesting thingy, didn't know it, thanks for pointing it out. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) Cache of relevant page is here: [http://web.archive.o.../...14\&Itemid=9](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112144739/www.3eportal.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=14&Itemid=9 "External link") derived from this: [http://forum.eeeuser...pic.php?id=1433](http://forum.eeeuser.com/viewtopic.php?id=1433 "External link") that derives from this: [http://www.ngine.de/...jsp?pageid=4176](http://www.ngine.de/index.jsp?pageid=4176 "External link") which derives from the original thread by **Dietmar** (with minor contributions from yours truly ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)): [http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=14181](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=14181 "External link")
There is another known-to-be-working automated method: [http://www.usboot.org/tiki-index.php](http://www.usboot.org/tiki-index.php "External link") There is no "need", and again you will need to trust my word for it ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) for cfadisk.sys or dummydisk.sys. Actually cfadisk and dummydisk were found: [http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=14292](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=14292 "External link") [http://www.911cd.net...o...181\&st=1954](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=14181&st=1954 "External link") well AFTER booting XP from USB "became" possible. Unless you need Windows Update working or want to use a multipartitioned stick, there is no need for them, though a multipartitioned stick gives some advantages: [http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=21572](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=21572 "External link") [http://www.boot-land...?...ic=5397\&hl=](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=5397&hl= "External link") There are a number of apps that may behave "strangely" when a Filter Driver is installed. But the "real thing" is using the Manufacturer Utility to "flip" the Removable bit **once and for all**. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) [http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=15776](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=15776 "External link") A number of such utilities are collected in a quite accessible to Western eyes Russian page: [http://www.flashboot...php?name=iflash](http://www.flashboot.ru/index.php?name=iflash "External link") I know that it may be an "overload" of data, but you may need to learn a bit of Chinese (or - easier ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) - use extensively google translate and some - read LOTS - of imagination): [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=4661](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=4661 "External link") You can use Chipgenius just to identify your chip and then search on the Russian page before attempting a Chinese search.....![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) jaclaz
